title: Easy Sheet Pan Greek Chicken Recipe
description: This sheet pan dinner for Greek-inspired chicken, potatoes, and peppers is simple to prepare and cooks in under 30 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Greek Easy Sheet Pan Greek Chicken 4.3 (22) 21 Reviews 8 Photos This Greek-inspired sheet pan chicken dinner with potatoes and peppers is perfect for busy weeknights. Just toss ingredients together on a sheet pan, then season, bake, and enjoy! Submitted by fabeveryday Updated on November 23, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 1 ½ pounds yellow potatoes, cubed 2 medium red bell peppers, seeded and chopped ½ cup coarsely chopped red onion 2 teaspoons minced garlic 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 medium lemons, cut into wedges 1 tablespoon dried oregano freshly cracked salt and pepper to taste ½ cup pitted Kalamata olives Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Toss chicken, potatoes, bell peppers, onion, oil, and garlic together in a large bowl until well combined. Transfer mixture to a large sheet pan and spread into a single layer. Squeeze lemon wedges over top, then place spent wedges onto the sheet pan. Sprinkle oregano over top, then season with salt and pepper. Add Kalamata olives. Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are fork-tender and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken breasts should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Sheet Pan Greek Chicken 01 of 08 Photo by  fabeveryday 02 of 08 Photo by  Not A Chef 08/18/2024 Easy to follow A keeper! I read reviews first and am glad I did. I parboiled the potatoes to make sure they were done at same time as the chicken. I halved the recipe, cut the chicken into chunks (not bite-sized), and used a Greek seasoning instead of plain oregano also based on user comments. 25 minutes and chicken was 162° and by time plates were ready the temp was 166°. Served with a topping of chunky feta cheese. 03 of 08 Photo by  Gregg Jesperson 01/06/2021 Excellent quick recipe for when you are in a hurry but want 'better than restaurant quality' cuisine! I added LOTS more garlic and lemon and then marinated it for 5 hours in a sealed bag in the fridge. Bake time was 45 minutes...Awesome results ;-) Next time, I will add some feta to the recipe to bake in some more flavor. 04 of 08 Photo by  Gregg Jesperson 01/06/2021 Excellent quick recipe for when you are in a hurry but want 'better than restaurant quality' cuisine! I added LOTS more garlic and lemon and then marinated it for 5 hours in a sealed bag in the fridge. Bake time was 45 minutes...Awesome results ;-) Next time, I will add some feta to the recipe to bake in some more flavor. 05 of 08 Photo by  Gregg Jesperson 01/06/2021 Excellent quick recipe for when you are in a hurry but want 'better than restaurant quality' cuisine! I added LOTS more garlic and lemon and then marinated it for 5 hours in a sealed bag in the fridge. Bake time was 45 minutes...Awesome results ;-) Next time, I will add some feta to the recipe to bake in some more flavor. 06 of 08 Photo by  Tess Skilling 01/06/2021 Easy delicious healthy Will definitely make again!! 07 of 08 Photo by  Michael 09/14/2020 Absolutely delicious! 08 of 08 Photo by  fabeveryday 08/25/2020 1 You’ll Also Love Chicken Souvlaki Salad 7 Ratings Greek-Stuffed Chicken Breast with Lemon Sauce 5 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken Sheet Pan Dinner 208 Ratings Sheet Pan Sweet and Sour Chicken 20 Ratings Greek Lemon Chicken and Potato Bake 884 Ratings Greek Chicken Quinoa Bowl 5 Ratings Feta-Brined Chicken Breasts 3 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken and Pepper Casserole 31 Ratings Instant Pot Greek Chicken 22 Ratings Sheet Pan Parmesan Chicken and Veggies 136 Ratings Greek Island Chicken Shish Kebabs 77 Ratings Mediterranean Chicken and Orzo Salad In Red Pepper Cups 48 Ratings Pineapple Salsa Chicken 16 Ratings Honey Mustard Chicken Sheet Pan Dinner with Potatoes and Corn 3 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas 443 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken Dinner for Two 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).;Toss chicken, potatoes, bell peppers, onion, oil, and garlic together in a large bowl until well combined. Transfer mixture to a large sheet pan and spread into a single layer. Squeeze lemon wedges over top, then place spent wedges onto the sheet pan. Sprinkle oregano over top, then season with salt and pepper. Add Kalamata olives.;Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are fork-tender and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken breasts should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
